intro: Coussapoa krukovii, commonly known as the Krukov's sphaerocaryon, is a flowering plant species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
